intro: Mauria biringo var. weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's Mauria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
